result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Emmanuel Novak Jr in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Michael Emmanuel Novak Jr.  Attorney Grace Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a court trial.  Court set final pretrial and court trial dates.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 10-05-2022 and all responses to be filed by 11-02-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (10 pages) commencing 07-28-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Michael Emmanuel Novak in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Longley.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Emmanuel Novak in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Attorney Sargent is unable to appear due to his congested calendar.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Stephen Sargent
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brianna E.K.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Emmanuel Novak in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
